props.synopsis: An act of terror took the lives of 15 people at Bondi. Their names, stories and legacies are held close by a shaken, grieving community.

title.children: Nation mourns under the shadow of terror

image.altText: Woman cries at Bondi Beach memorial 151225

props.synopsis: Crisis hotline Lifeline has experienced its busiest day of the year in the wake of the Bondi mass shooting, with more than 4,300 calls made in 24 hours.

title.children: Dramatic influx of calls to crisis hotlines after Bondi mass shooting

image.altText: The prime minister shakes Ahmed Al Ahmed's hand in hospital bed

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visits Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed at St George Hospital in Sydney's south.

title.children: Albanese visits Ahmed Al Ahmed as Bondi hero's first video message circulates

image.altText: John Howard attends memorial

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard, whose gun reforms fundamentally reshaped Australia, says he would support further tightening, but it cannot be made into a distraction or an "excuse" not to tackle antisemitism.

title.children: John Howard calls push to tighten gun laws an 'attempted diversion'

image.altText: A composite image of Bondi shooters Naveed and Sajid Akram taken from video stills, showing the different guns they used.

props.synopsis: The Bondi shooter's gun licence entitled him to an uncapped quantity of certain kinds of rifles and shotguns.

title.children: The Bondi shooter only had a basic gun licence. How could he buy multiple high-powered rifles?

image.altText: A older man in a pageboy's cap and suit stands behind microphones and next to two people in suits

props.synopsis: A Holocaust survivor says the Bondi terror attack should be "a wake-up call" for the nation as the South Australian government double its funding for education programs.

title.children: SA government doubles Holocaust education funding after Bondi attack

image.altText: UNCLASSIFIED: Aerial military camera of boat transiting through the ocean.

props.synopsis: The US military says 8 people have been killed in strikes targeting "designated terrorist organisations".

title.children: US hits three more suspected drug boats in Pacific

image.altText: David Sharaz

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's husband David Sharaz is declared bankrupt in the federal court, two months after former senator Linda Reynolds served him bankruptcy papers.

title.children: David Sharaz declared bankrupt just days after Brittany Higgins ruling

image.altText: Singer Cliff Richard dressed in blue patterned suit and tie and tinted glasses.

props.synopsis: The 85-year-old singer says the disease has been successfully treated, and he is urging people to get checked.

title.children: UK pop star Sir Cliff Richard reveals prostate cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Rob Reiner and his wife Michele posing for a photo on a red carpet

props.synopsis: As Nick Reiner, son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, is arrested on suspicion of their murder, US President Donald Trump's response sparks a bipartisan backlash.

title.children: What we know about Rob Reiner's death as Trump comments spark outrage

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing glasses talks to the camera.

props.synopsis: Former Darwin real estate agent Suzi Milgate has been found guilty of aggravated assault after pushing a cream-covered crepe into the face of a former Northern Territory chief minister.

title.children: Suzi Milgate guilty of aggravated assault over crepe attack

image.altText: Pat Cummins bowls in the nets.

props.synopsis: The third Ashes Test is upon us and the series is on the line. Here's everything you need to know about the clash in Adelaide.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval

image.altText: A paper bag containing fresh vegetables and a packet of rice.

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog is suing home meal delivery providers HelloFresh and Youfoodz for allegedly misleading consumers over subscriptions.

title.children: HelloFresh and Youfoodz sued by ACCC over allegedly misleading consumers

image.altText: A WA Police badge on an officer's shirt shoulder.

props.synopsis: A man is charged after allegedly wearing a necklace displaying a Nazi symbol, caught by increased police patrols in WA after the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Nazi symbol charge for 18yo arrested near Perth mosque

image.altText: A koala clings tightly to hand rail in city bus

props.synopsis: A rescue groups says the quick-thinking of a Brisbane bus driver could have saved the koala — named Peri — from being hit by traffic on a busy road.

title.children: Koala catches a ride on Brisbane bus after dash across busy suburban street

image.altText: Tim Tszyu flexes before a boxing match

props.synopsis: As Tim Tszyu prepares to put his boxing career on the line, here's everything you need to know about the former world champion's return bout.

title.children: All the details for Tim Tszyu's comeback fight

image.altText: monopoly board set up for a game

props.synopsis: Over the holiday period, the right game can make all the difference while spending time with friends and family.

title.children: Put away the Monopoly board: Best games to play and gift this summer

image.altText: Laura sits in bed smiling while working on her laptop, with her white and black cat Giles

props.synopsis: It took me a long time to decide to get a cat, and just as long to adopt after I had decided. When I saw Giles, any lingering uncertainties I had disappeared.

title.children: Laura was uncertain about whether to adopt a cat, until she met Giles

image.altText: A sky is covered in bushfire smoke. A truck is parked on the gravel side of a road near crop.

props.synopsis: As firefighters continue to battle bushfires across WA's south-west land division, a century-old mission, which was part of the Stolen Generations history, has reportedly been badly damaged in the fire.

title.children: Bushfire damages century-old mission in WA

image.altText: GettyImages-966334616

props.synopsis: A NSW cricketer, who has played at Sheffield Shield level, is banned from playing after allegations he sent nude photos to young teammates.

title.children: Cricketer banned after allegations he sent nude photos to teammates

image.altText: A man poses with his fist

props.synopsis: Kwang Kyung Yoo murdered a woman and child at a Sydney taekwondo studio before killing the woman's husband at their home.

title.children: Former taekwondo instructor jailed for 'senseless' murders of three people

image.altText: street sign of Aerodrome Rd and Fourth Ave

props.synopsis: A 38-year-old man has been charged with eight counts of attempted murder after allegedly driving his car at a group of pedestrians.

title.children: Woman dies after car hits pedestrians in Maroochydore

image.altText: Four golden mushrooms growing in the grass of a cattle paddock.

props.synopsis: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

title.children: Nimbin farmer warns magic mushrooms sprayed with poison

image.altText: A snowman made of sand is seen on Christmas Day at Bondi Beach in Sydney

props.synopsis: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

title.children: Christmas Day to deliver heatwave, tropical storms and festive sunshine

image.altText: Donald Trump looks sideways. Dressed in blue jacket and white shirt.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has filed a defamation lawsuit against the BBC in Miami federal court, seeking at least $US10 billion ($15.1 billion) in damages.

title.children: Trump sues BBC for $US10 billion over documentary edit

image.altText: Donald Trump welcomes Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine could see NATO-like security guarantees extended to Kyiv under a peace deal.

title.children: Ukraine says 'real progress' made in marathon peace talks

image.altText: The LA skyline is seen in front of mountains.

props.synopsis: US authorities say a New Year's Eve terror plot to bomb five sites in California and attack immigration agents has been thwarted.

title.children: Terrorists were planning New Year's Eve bombings in LA, US authorities say

image.altText: Multiple FBI officers walk around outside a home during the day as snow blankets the lawn

props.synopsis: With police releasing a person of interest, the manhunt continues for the Brown University shooter who killed two students and injured nine others.

title.children: Manhunt renewed after police release Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: Firefighters and Red Cross workers are at the crash scene alongside red fire truck.

props.synopsis: Authorities say the accident took place in San Mateo Atenco, an industrial area 5 kilometres from the Toluca airport.

title.children: Mexico small plane crash leaves at least 7 dead

image.altText: All Blacks' Silver Fern Flag and the New Zealand flag

props.synopsis: The RBA's interest rate-cutting cycle is at an end, and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

title.children: Multiple rate hikes next year? First look across the Tasman

image.altText: Samantha Hind lies in bed in a hospital wearing a neck brace.

props.synopsis: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

title.children: Woman run over by car while sunbaking reunites with paramedics who saved her

image.altText: A man wears a face covering and black hat as he walks along wearing a black jacket.

props.synopsis: A Bywong man pleads guilty in the Queanbeyan Local Court to aggravated animal cruelty after dragging a conscious kangaroo behind his car earlier this year.

title.children: Bywong man pleads guilty to dragging conscious kangaroo behind car

image.altText: A group of people stand in a barge in the ocean, silhouetted against a bushfire and smoke billowing into the sky.

props.synopsis: Locals of an east coast Tasmanian community say they urged authorities to tighten rules around burn-offs in the years before yet another bushfire tore through the area.

title.children: Bushfire-prone community urged action on burn-offs, to no avail

image.altText: Three young people look at toys on shelves in a store.

props.synopsis: A dozen children have gone on a shopping spree to pick presents for kids their age who otherwise may not have presents under their tree.

title.children: These kids spent $20,000 on toys, but didn't take any of them home
